item.title: Data Analytics Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Analyst

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms.  Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s).  Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit.  Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions.  Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

What will you do?

Analytics Lab Support

  • Assist in the creation and maintenance of foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors.

Business Case Development and Adoption Support

  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.

Technological use and Reuse

  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team.
  • Support global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis.

Leadership & People Development

  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors.

What do you need to succeed?

Overall

  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • Strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Knowledge of auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.

Technical experience:

  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Working knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Working knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proficient data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Proficient data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark

Leadership and People Management experience:

  • Demonstrates they have successfully worked in inclusive and diverse work teams
  • Proven ability to multitask and prioritize activities; across borders and cultures
  • Experience working as a team member on a special project, over an extended period of time

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $65,000 - $105,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USAUDIT23

Job Summary

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals. These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-01-12-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-01-28-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Director, Applied Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Applied Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As we grow and diversify our data portfolio – we are looking for a leader to join our team to help manage and grow our Data Science, Analytics and Dashboard & Visualization remit. This leader will have a broad mandate of transforming data into business opportunities and insights; and will look to solve for the question – “how do I help my stakeholders use data to make better, quicker and more insightful decisions”.

Core objectives would include:

  • Develop the roadmap and vision for analytics and the data science driven features that are aligned with the business goals and priorities
  • As a product owner of PowerBI - build, enhance and enable self-serve analytics and visualization skillsets across the organization,
  • Grow and enable a team of high performing data scientists and analysts to prospect, scope and deliver on use cases for advanced analytics, machine learning, artificial intelligence etc.
  • Liaise with rest of Data Management team to deliver intelligence and solutions using substantial innovation, resourcefulness, and diplomacy

In this role, you will provide leadership and champion the creation and management of descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics & tools.  This leadership position requires a deep understanding of the role that Data Science can play in Investment Banking and apply advanced analytic data modeling and machine learning to all areas of the business. As a result, an active interest in understanding of financial and operational activities, within the context of Institutional Banking and Asset Management services, will be an asset.

What will you do?

Data Science Mandate

  • Continue to enable the implementation and creation of best practices for statistical data modelling, analysis and machine learning in support of the IS business
  • Evangelize, implement and provide consultation on modern data science strategies and practices aligned to Investor Services strategic vision
  • Understand our business and operational practices to develop use cases to solve for complex challenges
  • Lead in building out ML models where they will identify key data features that enable the derivation of insights that are predictive in nature and enable stakeholders to take action for improved outcomes
  • Work collaboratively across other teams and leaders to define, measure, develop and deliver analytics products and solutions which impact Investor Serivces’s PNL.
  • Manage relationships with various senior business stakeholders as competing priorities need to be appropriately triaged
  • Provide concentrated guidance and support to the Data Science team and partnering Data teams from an end-to-end perspective – as a result donning multiple hats of Product Owner, Product Management, Exception & Risk Management etc
  • Maintain awareness and support research of emerging data science techniques, technologies, and potential business applications for ML/AI – and how it informs Data Science roadmap and vision
  • Build towards a vision of managing a robust library of data science products and solutions, with reusable and extensible code, logic, algorithms etc

Visualization & PowerBI Mandate

  • Be Product Owner and champion of the PowerBI and other suite of Azure analytical products – create and maintain robust roadmap and vision
  • Build, maintain and support key reports and dashboards to drive higher visibility, intelligence and accountability for our business partners
  • Partner with Architecture and Engineering teams in designing and building cloud-based infrastructure to facilitate analytics and experimentation
  • Partner with Product, Service, Operations to build out and own business measurement frameworks including Management Insights, KPIs, KRIs – ensure these are tracking against forecasts and provide commentary on insights.
  • Mitigate possible avenues of risk and bottlenecks as the usage of these tools continue to be adopted across the organization.
  • Partner with architecture and technology teams to explore cutting edge alternatives on cloud and across RBC COE
  • Ensure accurate documentation, onboarding, training, auditing and self-serve driven adoption of PowerBI tools across business domains 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Master\'s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or other quantitative field
  • 7+ years of working within analytics and data science field
  • 5+ years of leading and growing teams
  • Quick learner of business and financial industry practices, with strong analytical capability
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills, with strong facilitation and presentation skills to distill complex ideas and achievements to executive management
  • Mandatory experience working in a cloud environment such as Azure, and their tooling such as PowerBI and Databricks

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge in banking/finance or asset management is beneficial but not required
  • Advanced degree or research-based experience is desired but should be above and beyond must-have experience

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Excellent exposure to communicate with various business partners and stakeholders in Investor & Treasury Services and within other platforms as appropriate
  • Opportunity to obtain hands-on experience throughout your role
  • Working with an exciting, close-knit, supportive & dynamic group
  • Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within the bank
  • Excellent career development and progression opportunities
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Competitive compensation

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Investor and Treasury Services

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-02-23-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-03-09-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Engineering Director – Data, Analytics, & Insights
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Engineering Director – Data, Analytics, & Insights

Job Description

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

RBC is looking to standup a new Cash Management Offering in the United States.  It will entail a standing up a new Digital Bank for Commercial Clients. 

The USCM Data, Analytics, & Insights team plays a key role in supporting the data requirements needed to support this new line of business.  In this role you will be responsible for leading a team of Data Engineers and Quality Automation Engineers to delivery new, enhance existing, or maintain data capabilities supplied by our Data team.  The role will coordinate, develop, lead, communicate and execute activities to ensure objectives are accomplished according to requirements, plan and schedule.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

  • Establish strong working relationships across business units and technology platforms to build influence and impact with key business partners. Collaborate with groups to define and achieve deliverables and ensure initiatives are effectively integrated into RBC procedures and processes.
  • Collaborate and contribute on cross-functional enterprise initiatives and manage the effective implementation of assigned deliverables, but always adhering to principles of safety and soundness.
  • Provide oversight in the technical design of solutions to ensure optimal use of software facilities and features.
  • Provide support and hold teams accountable for adherence to standards and policies; escalate non-conformance.
  • Lead and/or coordinate activities to resolve complex technical issues/problems.
  • Maintain awareness of data, analytics, and insight trends and provide relevant context to the technical and business leads.
  • Support the research and evaluation of new data capabilities.
  • Provide training, coaching and mentoring to team members, to maximize their level of technical expertise. 
  • Coordinating coding, testing, implementation and documentation of application solutions.

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have:

  • Team leadership and management skills
  • 5+ years’ experience, coupled with complex programs with high frequency of requests and multiple priorities.
  • Expert technical knowledge of data and data analytics technology.
  • Highest level of proven competence with data manipulation languages, data definition languages, physical database design, and application performance analysis & tuning.
  • Demonstrated ability in written and oral communication skills along with strong presentation skills. Ability to determine the information and communication needs of the stakeholders and initiatives.
  • Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high quality standards while handling a variety of tasks and deadlines simultaneously.

Nice-to-have: 

  • Strong knowledge of business intelligence, automation and security tools and standards.
  • Knowledge of data science
  • Ability to learn and absorb quickly new concepts (in business and in systems), apply new knowledge as appropriate and transfer knowledge to others

What’s in it for you?

  • Work and learn latest technologies in Big Data, Containers-based Micro-services development
  • Work on impactful project for the organization
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team  Flexible work/life balance options

The good faith expected salary for the above position is $150K -250K depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate\'s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs. This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.
RBC\'s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:
· Drives RBC\'s high performance culture
· Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals
· Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USCASHMGMT

Job Summary

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Technology and Operations

Regular

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. item.title: Senior Manager, Business Analytics & Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Business Analytics & Reporting

Job Description

What is the Mandate?

  • Using an agile framework develop and maintain Apptio backlog
  • Work with Apptio product owner to create and manage the pipeline of ideas and requirements for the Apptio backlog
  • Coordinate daily scrum meetings
  • Capture feature user stories
  • Facilitate the prioritization of user stories and manage dependencies
  • Create mock ups for each feature including acceptance criteria
  • Facilitate backlog prioritization and dependency management
  • Ensure there are no sprint blockers
  • Manage scrum sprint board and create custom dashboards
  • Maintain /  host governance meetings with key Apptio Stakeholders (Service Owners, Tower Leads, BAS and Finance) to support key processes such as monthly variance analysis, review and sign off of thresholds for LoB charge-out etc
  • Lead and host monthly stakeholder meetings to share Apptio progress, review stakeholder requirements etc.
  • Build out monthly reporting and analytics to be able to support BAS, Finance and Service Owner discussions and analysis that provide insights on impact to RBC’s lines of business
  • Support the Director, TI Business Analytics & Reporting with roadmap communication and strategy development
  • Responsible for communication of roadmap with stakeholders and solicit feedback to be incorporated
  • Responsible for gathering and documenting and receiving sign off from stakeholders on new requirements
  • Responsible for monthly reporting to senior executives on chargeback to LoBs as well as progress of Apptio
  • Responsible for working with Service Owners in helping understand both their indirect and direct costs
  • Responsible for creating and maintaining TI’s Wall of Numbers for the Productivity & Efficiency program

What are the Skills Required?

  • Knowledge of Agile Framework and Scrum including ceremonies and artifacts
  • Familiarity with agile and Jira Software
  • Strong understanding of NIE and chargeout methodologies at RBC
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Ability to collaborate and make an impact in a matrix environment
  • Exceptional knowledge and application usage of Microsoft Office (Powerpoint, Excel etc.)
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to understand complex concepts and be able to simplify for a number of users

#Lin-Hybrid.

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

Canada

Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

RBC is looking to standup a new Cash Management Offering in the United States.  It will entail a standing up a new Digital Bank for Commercial Clients.

item.title: Senior Director, Data and Analytics COE
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Director, Data and Analytics COE

Job Description

What is the role?

The Senior Director, Data & Analytics COE is responsible for leading a data and analytics Centre of Expertise and a team of data professionals within Canadian Banking Operations in support of Win For Today and Transform for Tomorrow P&CB imperatives.  The Senior Director, Data & Analytics COE oversees the entire data and insight production life cycle from collection to destruction, leads innovations that leverages AI to elevate human/technology interaction, and executes across Operations Big Rocks objectives driving workforce insights and timely strategic decisions, enabling “Operations at Scale”.

The Data & Analytics COE specializes in taking full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights that would have not been possible with traditional analytics.  Leveraging leading edge technologies and capabilities, the COE applies machine learning and statistical modelling techniques to help RBC understand the changing business environment, discover new growth opportunities and determine where business improvements can be made.  This work is innovative, has a high level of complexity, and requires significant attention to detail. The Senior Director, Data & Analytics COE represents P&CB Operations to lead and participate in key enterprise and P&CB initiatives including Data Hub & Chapter enabling Mega Journeys, enable insight delivery supporting Operations Product Hub including Process 360, support governance priorities in Chief Data Office and P&CB Data Management Office, drive forward CBO Data Community including data leaders on sharing best practices.

What will you do?

  • Lead a team of Data & Analytics professionals in delivering on their day to day mandate, while professionally developing them to create a foundation of data professionals for the future of CBO
  • Evolution and implementation of Canadian Banking Operations Data Strategy in support of “Operations at Scale” architecture and technology
  • Mature data science model development and insight generation/delivery platform making data more accessible and advancing analytics capabilities (use data science to elevate human/technology interaction for higher productivity and use of machine learning to enable automation through unstructured data access)
  • Develop key strategic partnerships with enterprise data/technology teams including Chief Data Office, P&CB Data Management Office, Enterprise DNA team (e.g. leading a “data squad” including 10-12 resources from DNA supporting key strategic data initiatives) across data architecture, services, engineering and science capabilities; leverage enterprise investments to maximize business value creation
  • Support Process 360/PATH development, maturity and use across CB Operations
  • Lead/Chair the data community in CB Operations (includes ~20 data leaders across different Operations teams) to facilitate data and capability sharing and advancement.
  • Lead data & insight support for CB Operations Big Rocks- E2E Process, CBO Dual Operating Model, Igniting our Workforce. Strategic use of big data through data lake to streamline >20 key data sources for operations performance/productivity driven analytics use cases.

Must have Skills

  • Proven leadership skills in executing and leading Strategy, People, Data and Technology with a reputation for accountability, being proactive and striving for excellence and continuous improvement.
  • Successful track record of setting up and transforming data & analytics practices. Strong analytical skills coupled with data engineering and science knowledge on application of business use cases including client, product and operations process analytics.
  • Talent developer and strong collaborator with capability to attract and develop top talents as well as liaising business and technology teams to deliver results.

Technical Skills

  • 5+ years of experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark
  • 5+ years of experience in Machine-Learning, data mining and statistics
  • Strong coding capabilities and expert working knowledge of Python, R, Java and SQL
  • Expert data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • Strong knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data science technologies and ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders.

What\'s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, and work/life balance options
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • To be part of a large and growing global organization which puts client interests first and has a culture of fairness and accountability

Job Summary

The Senior Director, Data & Analytics COE is responsible for leading a data and analytics Centre of Expertise and a team of data professionals within Canadian Banking Operations in support of Win For Today and Transform for Tomorrow P&CB imperatives. The Senior Director, Data & Analytics COE oversees the entire data and insight production life cycle from collection to destruction, leads innovations that leverages AI to elevate human/technology interaction, and executes across Operations Big Rocks objectives driving workforce insights and timely strategic decisions, enabling “Operations at Scale”.

The Data & Analytics COE specializes in taking full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights that would have not been possible with traditional analytics. Leveraging leading edge technologies and capabilities, the COE applies machine learning and statistical modelling techniques to help RBC understand the changing business environment, discover new growth opportunities and determine where business improvements can be made. This work is innovative, has a high level of complexity, and requires significant attention to detail. The Senior Director, Data & Analytics COE represents P&CB Operations to lead and participate in key enterprise and P&CB initiatives including Data Hub & Chapter enabling Mega Journeys, enable insight delivery supporting Operations Product Hub including Process 360, support governance priorities in Chief Data Office and P&CB Data Management Office, drive forward CBO Data Community including data leaders on sharing best practices.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Canada

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Senior Associate - Reporting & Analytics (Jersey)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Associate - Reporting & Analytics (Jersey)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Reporting to the Head of Data Analytics you will work closely with business and technology teams across Wealth Management International (WMI) to support the delivery of analytical
insights, develop and curate data assets, build dashboards and model data that will enable data driven decisions.

What will you do?

  • Develop, enhance and maintain the evolving Data Analytics data infrastructure in line with the business needs to support the overarching data strategy across the organisation
  • Identify, source, stage and model data using industry standard technologies and established development and operational practices as part of the end-to-end data lifecycle
  • Work with the business to identify and source data points across core platforms and processes for inclusion within the Data Analytics data repository
  • Ability to structure large disparate data sets to serve multiple functions and tailor the results for specific audiences, creating models to support investigation and analysis
  • Ability to create new and modify existing T-SQL scripts, stored procedures and SSIS packages to support new and regular reporting requirements Research, explore and understand business problems and reporting requirements to facilitate the design, development and deployment of solutions and dashboards, enabling end user self-service, incorporating drill-down functionality
  • Provide data driven and thought provoking insights to drive informed decision-making, transferring knowledge to stakeholders and enabling the business to use its data more effectively
  • Through the delivery of informative reporting solutions; support, inspire and educate end-users to use data more effectively to improve overarching data literacy across the organisation
  • Analyse, document and recommend improvements to existing business practices to capitalise on opportunities for automation, efficiencies and risk reduction to enhance capabilities and streamline end-to-end data related processes
  • Work in conjunction with Finance and Technology functions to understand the reconciliations process and flow of data across applications
  • Actively engage within the team and wider business areas to foster relationships and develop thought leadership Responsible for the design, development and ongoing maintenance of the scalable Data Analytics data infrastructure using the Microsoft SQL technology stack to serve as the foundational layer for analytics and insights, support and guide team on technical design and implementations
  • Adhere to and promote the the DevOps process to ensure that new or changes to existing source code or DB structure follow the agreed development and release processes and that all productionised code is adequately documented and reviewed

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Proven experience with MS SQL Server
  • Sound understanding of relational database principals, guidelines and design
  • Extensive SQL query development experience
  • Familiarity and experience with data visualisation tools
  • Data management specialist with ability to mine data and predictive modelling
  • Advanced knowledge of, and experience in manipulating large disparate data sets from multiple sources in multiple formats

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of Tableau
  • Experience with JIRA
  • Experience with GitHub
  • Knowledge of Agile project management principles
  • Knowledge of R and Python

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible working options fully supported
  • Hybrid Working

Saint Helier, Jersey

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Analytics & Monitoring Lead
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Analytics & Monitoring Lead

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

An integral member of Canadian Banking’s (CB) Compliance’s Leadership team that leads the group’s high profile, comprehensive, Monitoring Compliance program and devises the overall Monitoring Strategy and executes against this strategy by building future oriented, foundational data and analytical capabilities that, proactively surface regulatory risks and keeps pace with ever changing business, regulatory and technological trends, and advancements. This role identifies, designs, and successfully delivers data solutions and analytics that drive insightful, action-oriented outcomes and works collaboratively across partners to solve business problems that support dynamic, risk based and effective regulatory risk management practices.

What will you do?

  • Employ strategic vision to plan future technology and program needs based on regulatory and industry trends and new or proposed regulatory changes.

  • Business oriented solutions grounded in a fundamental understanding of the Canadian Banking’s strategy, products and services and the associated regulatory risks.

  • Generates ideas, spots opportunities, devising hypotheses/problem statements, what if scenarios and analyzes potential use cases aligned to Compliance’s risk-based approach while building a pipeline of future opportunities. 

  • Triangulates insights across regulatory themes to identify patterns and trends that provide a holistic and integrated view of regulatory compliance risks for the business.

  • Leverages a wide range of data analysis techniques and statistical modeling and methods to identify control gaps, build alerts and detection systems that identify and mitigate regulatory, financial and reputational risks; has exposure or open to learning advanced data techniques (ie. machine learning, NLP, AI, RPA, etc.)

  • Leads the design of data profiles which includes (i) identification and prioritization of key raw data elements, (ii) data cleansing, harmonization, and augmentation, (iii) data ingestion into digestible/consumable formats, (iv) data manipulation and (v) data visualization.

  • Builds strong relationship, credibility with stakeholders and business partners by taking a keen interest and understanding of their business and needs

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Impact, influence maturity and communication and relationship management skills to deal effectively with stakeholders & SMEs

  • Experience with big data technologies, data modelling, statistical methods; familiarity with SQL, SAS, Databases, Python, Spark, Hadoop, Power BI, Tableau, etc.

  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data (structured and unstructured) and present findings to stakeholders.

  • Experience with change management, experience working in Agile environments.

Nice-to-have

Diverse knowledge of P&CB strategy, products, services, data lake and systems

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Job Summary

item.title: Associate Director, Risk and Investment Analytics Product Owner
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Risk and Investment Analytics Product Owner

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, your primary responsibility will be around our Risk and Investment Analytics (R&IA) services which include Performance Reporting and Compliance monitoring services within Investor Services (“IS”). You will support the overall product strategy, direction and profitability for R&IA within RBC Investor Services, in alignment with the organization’s strategic objectives. In addition, you will support designing and developing product features to support client retention, target client acquisition, enhance client experience, help improve operational efficiency and deliver on commitments made to clients, including drive and oversee execution of approved product change/development, as well as support the Product Standards & the operating framework for R&IA.

What will you do?

  • Proactively involved in the assessment of available market intelligence and stakeholder feedback (clients and functions) on strategy and evolution of the Risk and Investment Analytics service, including target market, features, and product/service experience
  • Support development and maintenance of the R&IA product with a focus on delivering NIAT growth through enhancing and digitizing the product offering, generating client value and driving operational efficiency
  • Deliver a clear product roadmap in-collaboration with the Product team, Client Experience, Client Operations and Client Coverage
  • Work with the analyst team to conduct analysis on the development of product-related change and ensure change remains aligned to existing regulation and/or internal RBC policies
  • Support the design of the R&IA operating model(s), product standards and technical stack/architecture, with an objective to simplify and drive efficiency
  • Support client retention, win and/or upsell in collaboration with the business development team;
  • Work with the analyst team to gain an in-depth understanding of the P&L for the Risk and Investment Analytics services and embed financials in driving client, product, execution and functional change on product profitability
  • Develop an in-depth understanding of the upstream services such as Custody, Fund accounting and Private Capital Services how the data from these services impacts into Risk and Investment analytics
  • Responsible for collaborating with product team to improve upstream data that R&IA is reliant to improve efficiency and enhance the product offering
  • Gather sustainable, ongoing information in relation to client satisfaction with current RBC I&TS product suite and expectations for future product delivery
  • Responsible for ensuring appropriate governance, compliance with policies/frameworks and oversight of issues, risks, audit and compliance items
  • Present to RBC and IS senior management as requested by Product Heads and lead delivery of one-off initiatives as required by the Digital Client Experience and Product segment

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • BA or BSc in business, or other relevant degree
  • Over 5 years’ experience in the asset servicing industry, with a specific focus in  Performance reporting and Compliance monitoring services
  • Sound technical knowledge of the financial services and asset management industry
  • Experience in developing efficient strategies and business plans for Investment Performance and Compliance monitoring services
  • Strong technical knowledge and technical translation skills
  • Comfort in using sophisticated business information and analytic tools
  • Ability to understand both finance and business realities to challenge decisions Highly organized, self-motivated and entrepreneurial with drive to deliver products in-support of client experience and profitability objectives
  • Strong relationship management, communications and partnership development capabilities and skills
  • Ability to consume and distill significant amount of information and data and be able to present it in a simple manner to support decision making (so effectively strong communication skills north written and spoken)
  • Comfortable with ambiguity, a self-starter, someone who can also create their own day and results oriented
  • Excellent client service skills
  • Ability to manage small to medium sized teams 

Nice-to-have

  • MBA, MMA, CFA or post-graduate in business or finance
  • Professional qualifications from a recognized industry body
  • Fluency in French

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Excellent opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the RBC Investor 7 Treasury service business and gain knowledge and experience from a strong and diverse team
  • Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within the bank
  • Excellent career development and progression opportunities
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Competitive compensation

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Investor and Treasury Services

Job Type:

Regular

Salaried

2023-02-23-08:00

2023-03-09-08:00

item.title: Sr. Manager, Reporting & Analytics - USCM Tech
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, Reporting & Analytics - USCM Tech

Job Description


RBC has made the strategic decision to become a Disruptor in the U.S. Cash Management space. By starting this journey, there is a significant opportunity to evolve and capitalize on a $100 Billion Dollar market segment in the U.S. In support of this vision, RBC aims to offer a frictionless, embedded payment and liquidity experience for its clients.  While RBC has an established Cash Management business in Canada, the U.S. based group will be built from scratch and anchored in a technical/digital play vs. a traditional play, enabling the Bank to compete with new entrants in this space.

What is the opportunity?

The US Cash Management (USCM) Technology team is undertaking a green field project to build a brand-new system to serve corporate clients. In this role, you will be responsible for the overall collection, accuracy, and reporting of USCM Tech initiatives. ​

Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization\'s information system needs and requirements. Applies advanced in-depth and/or broad knowledge, considered a top resource across the organization.


What will you do?

  • Reporting and Shared Knowledge:
    • Manage the USCM Tech reporting calendar
    • Prepare routine internal portfolio reporting for team leadership on initiative status (financials, risks, benefits)
    • Coordinate portfolio reporting to senior executives (incl. T&O, Group Heads, Board of Directors, etc.)
    • Administer and maintain tools environment for enterprise reporting on behalf of USCM Tech team
    • Ensure consistent reporting processes, approach and tools are in place (factoring in regional differences)
    • Update tools and sites to support shared knowledge and ensure adherence and use of standardized tools and process
  • Data Analytics
    • Subject Matter Expert on gathering development of reporting tools, quality control and measurement of data.
    • Responsible for bringing leading industry best practices into reporting and analytics design solutions for USCM Tech to the table for senior management to review
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvements
  • Relationship and Communication
    • Provides executives and senior management with timely updates on project issues and manages communications including status reports
    • Effectively communicates and builds rapport with team members, stakeholders and interface groups across USCM using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close
    • Interacts with executives and senior management on the full range of matters related to USCM Tech reporting and analytics
  • Operational Risk, Compliance and Audits
    • Ensures operational risk activities are effectively managed and addressed.
    • Proactively monitors and ensures risk management deadlines are met and issues resolved on a timely basis.

Must have:

  • Experience with financial operations
  • 7+ years of project management experience with at least 3-5 years’ experience with large projects portfolios
  • Demonstrated data analytic & reporting experience
    • Experience using Tableau, SharePoint, Microsoft Office suite, JIRA and Confluenence
  • Strong client-focus and responsiveness to business needs
    • Experience in dashboard development
  • Well-developed communication and presentation skills including executive interaction

Nice to have:

  • PMP Certified or equivalent
  • Basic financial accounting knowledge
  • Exposure to financial services and/or financial products.

What\'s in It for You?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Positive work culture emphasizing diversity and inclusion, volunteerism, and community involvement
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including great benefits, annual incentive program and recognition
  • Leaders who support your development
  • A dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and grow your career
  • Work-life integration
